Key Match Events: LaMelo Ball scored a team-high 32 points
The Hornets took their first lead of the contest with Ball’s first points on a shot from downtown over Jusuf Nurkic
Bridges got down in the paint and provided a good counter for LaMelo and Miller’s perimeter games
Richards collected a double-double, 15 points and 12 rebounds off the bench with five offensive boards and three blocks
Miller hit a decisive three-pointer at the end of the game
Post-Match Reflections: LaMelo is making a compelling argument to start the All-Star Game
The only thing that could possibly get in his way is the poor record
Miscellaneous Highlights: Charlotte Hornets erased an early deficit to take down the Phoenix Suns, 115-104
Devin Booker led the Suns offense and led them to a seven-point lead after one
The second quarter was one of the best quarters the Hornets have played all season long
Richards outplayed and out-hustled Nurkic on both ends of the court
Miller had a couple of rushed turnovers early in the fourth
